website_summaries.verdict: When you want the easiest-to-use USB-C hub adapter around, this low-priced model is a smart choice.
pros: There aren't any frills with this hub adapter, making it easy to use at an extremely low price point
Delivers four USB-C 3.0 ports for plug-and-play simplicity
Extremely small design, which makes it a great choice when you're on the go
cons: Only ports available are USB Type C, so you won't have a lot of versatility here

customer_reviews.title: Works great, even when daisy chained
customer_reviews.text: Here is my setup: I have a MacBook Pro on my office desk connected via USB-C to an LG 5K monitor. The monitor has a built-in hub with 3 USB-C ports. I use this hub connected to one of the monitor ports to connect my legacy devices. So this hub is daisy-chained through another hub. I know you aren't supposed to do this, but I wanted to be able to unplug just a single cable when I took my MacBook away from my desk. In spite of the daisy chained connection, this hub works great. It's able to work with medium-power devices such as my DVD drive. It is small, light weight, and reasonably priced. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and then some
customer_reviews.text: I was upset when I found out my usb c port on my computer was only a gen1, despite despite not being able to put out video this USB hub really does take advantage of every bit of the usability of the port. I have a Microsoft natural keyboard, Logitech gaming mouse USB dogleg, monitor with a 2 USB port hub, and it will still run my Western Digital passport 2 terabyte hard external hard drive with no problem. It's really impressive from a hub that's not externally powered.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Allman

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: ETA: Aukey has contacted me and is in the midst of resolving the issue. Will update the review when the process is over. I don't really see the point of this product. It uses USB 3.0, so the entire device is limited to 5V @0.9A, meaning that if you plug in a phone for data transfer and a USB on another port, there isn't enough power for both to run simultaneously, meaning your transfer speeds will slow to a crawl. Build quality is decent like every other Aukey product I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Zain Mobhani

customer_reviews.title: Great for small motherboards!
customer_reviews.text: An absolute must have for an ITX motherboard. No noticeable lag, works perfectly. I might have to upgrade to a newer version with double the ports, but for now I’m very satisfied!!! It’s hooked up to an Gigabyte AORUS 570. For my $2,000 build this device maybe the best hub I’ve ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 2020

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple...great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Got this when I replaced an older Mac with a new MBP; didn't expect to be able to charge through it, but when I tried my AppleSuper Drive, I got this message..."Connect Apple USB SuperDrive to a USB port on this Mac." I rechecked the Amazon listing, and sure enough, it says "...Devices with high power demand such as Apple SuperDrive shouldn't be connected to the hub." So, my mistake. Excellent service from the seller, though! Device works the way it should, just be sure that’s enough for your needs.
customer_reviews.author: John Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works!
customer_reviews.text: - Very slim and light - Brushed-plastic casing - Compatible with my laptop (Lenovo Yoga 910) - Comes with a 24-month warranty if you register it on AUKEY's annoying website No complaints in the 2 hours I've been using it. Here, take five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Lam

customer_reviews.title: Compact and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Performs as described! This seems a very well made USB hub. The first thing to note is that it’s got a C type connection rather than a traditional USB connection. Works as described, It works just as it should, and the speed of data transfer is just what you would get from a USB 3.1 device. The wire seems very good quality and durable too, feels and performs better than any of them. A good product to be used at home or on the go!
customer_reviews.author: Kaela Dickinson DVM

customer_reviews.title: Causes WIFI to stop working on MacbookPro
customer_reviews.text: Super bummed with this thing. It did not work with my MacBookPro... every time I plugged it in to use my external drive my WiFi would instantly stop working. Very frustrating & could not get any work done. Googled it & tried the tinfoil method & it actually works. But that’s ridiculous & I’m not going to use it like that long term. Bought Satechi brand which is apparently approved & tested by Apple. Hopefully won’t have this same issue.
customer_reviews.author: victoriazsuzen

customer_reviews.title: Does a surprisingly great job for legacy devices
customer_reviews.text: I've slowly talked about getting some kind of USB-C hub for my current laptop I use so I can use a keyboard and gain extra usb ports instead of just having one. I also frequently use external HDDs. Thankfully this USB hub has worked amazingly for plugging in my keyboard, mouse, and a flash drive. I usually connect USB external HDDs straight to the laptop. Thanksfully the low 900mA power on the hub does not worry me much and have not had any power-based issues so far. I am amazed at how small and portable it is.. and how sleek it looks. I can surely recommend this little hub to use that then-useless type-C connector, especially if it's on sale
customer_reviews.author: Giusseppe G.

customer_reviews.title: poor connectivity with mouse and causes wifi interference
customer_reviews.text: Trying to use this with a new, top-of-the-line MacBook Pro and it's been nothing but problems: stuttering wireless mouse, unresponsive wireless keyboard, and occasional wi-fi interference to top it off. Unusable. Update: bumped star rating because seller was responsive and refunded my money for the dongle.
customer_reviews.author: Michele A.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and great price
customer_reviews.text: It works great with my laptop. It has 4 ports, so it is really nice to handle multiple devices. It's easy to use and works good as described.
customer_reviews.author: Little fish

customer_reviews.title: I use it on a iMac (Retina 5K, 27-inch, 2017)
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped Thunderbolt harddrives would have come down in price by now but, they really have not and the selection is still limited. So I decided to use one of the ports as a USB C to give me more USB ports. But this AUKEY is not powered. It turns out I need more POWERED USB ports. I've kept it but I have only 4 powered ports but 5 (or more) powered devices (two hard drives and some scanners and readers). If I can get a decently priced dual, changeable, external HD for $300 or less, that would free up one... Apple NEVER has enough USB ports on its Macs!
customer_reviews.author: N. HylandTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Small USB C hub which does the job and fits the bill.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward product. It's a USB C hub with four USB A 3.0 ports. Provides a solid connection for my mouse, keyboard, and headset. I use it to transfer dongles from my laptop to my desktop without unplugging everything each time I use the other machine. Construction is solid. It doesn't get hot when plugged in, it doesn't even remotely get warm. The cable could be longer (about 6 inches), but that's preference and the shorter cable could be beneficial to someone else's use case.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The Aukey USB C hub interferes with the WiFi reception of my new MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Aukey hub to expand my Mac’s type C port. The new ports worked just fine, but I lost WiFi reception when the hub was connected to a new MacBook Pro. Reception returned when I moved closer to the WiFi router. WiFi reception on my iPhone and USB wireless mouse were also interfered by the hub. My guess is that this hub lacks sufficient RF (radio frequency) shielding. A small shielding leak perhaps. I have since bought an Anker USB-C 4-in-1 Hub, and all works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Roger McBride

customer_reviews.title: A very helpful device
customer_reviews.text: Too many devices but limited USB port in my laptop. Using this device overcome that issue .. Now I have as many USB port as I need or even more. Most of the time I leave my wireless mouse and pendrives attached to this hub and when ever I need to use it just connect this hub to my laptop and it works. No heating problem. Plus point is with this hub I can directly use my pendrive in my S9 and V20 phone.
customer_reviews.author: Manoj Manandhar

customer_reviews.title: For the money works more than well enough.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to add some USB 3.0 ports to my laptop, this is a cheap and easy way to do so if you have USB-C Thunderbolt. At some point I'll get to extended device testing but it works fine with what I needed it for, to add 2 external HD's. The build is just fine, probably wouldn't break if I dropped it but it doesn't feel ridiculously sturdy either, but it is lightweight. I wouldn't mind the USB cable being a bit longer but again it's good enough. Packs in my laptop bag easily enough and has no problem powering 2 USB hard drives. So long as it keeps working no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Type-C Hub!
customer_reviews.text: It's a USB C hub with four USB A 3.0 ports and very slim and light and well manufactured. This USB C hub allows me to plug in my mouse, portable hard drive, and connect my Samsung note10+ Phone. It doesn't even get warm. full-speed ports and does not require additional external power. I am completely satisfied with this product and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: jinyoung, kim

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, came in nice packaging
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says. No setup needed, just plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Hair

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with 3 Oculus Rift CV1 sensors
customer_reviews.text: Trying to plug 3 Rift CV1 sensors into this hub doesn't work. Presumably you'll want a powered hub for 3+ sensors. Plugging the 3 sensors into an unrelated powered USB 3.0 hub, using a 6ft USB 3.0 extension cable from that hub to this USB Type-C hub, and then using a 6ft USB Type-C extension cable from this hub to a computer works fine though surprisingly.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Rhone

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Well this product did not even last me as long as I thought it would. I've had this product since Jan 2019 and its now March 2019. I use this for my business laptop for my Chromebox and it helps A LOT! So I had a huge disappointment when during my work on my laptop the part broke. I didn't expect for this to break, I thought this would last me a lot longer but unfortunately it didn't. I am past the allowed return date so I will just shop around and or maybe purchase this from Office Depot or something.
customer_reviews.author: Samie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on the go
customer_reviews.text: Small and light this works great. Plug it into you Type-C slot and you get 4 USB ports that work great. My laptop came with 1 type C and 2 USB... not enough for everything I'm trying to do while working remotely. Now I can plug in my home keyboard and mouse and printer into the Hub and just plug it into the laptop when I'm working from home. Pretty great and good value
customer_reviews.author: V Perl

customer_reviews.title: Plastic not aluminum
customer_reviews.text: I give it 3 stars total because the item is stated to be aluminum casing but is actually plastic. So far the item works as advertised. The connector is nice and tight and all the USB ports work. I recommend due to the cost of the item and the fact that it gets the job done. If you want something elegant then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: chuck jones

customer_reviews.title: You can buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I was upset when I found out my usb c port on my computer was only a gen1, despite despite not being able to put out video this USB hub really does take advantage of every bit of the usability of the port. I have a Microsoft natural keyboard, Logitech gaming mouse USB dogleq, monitor with a 2 USB port hub, and it will still run my Western Digital passport 2 terabvte hard external hard drive with no problem. It's really impressive from a hub that's not externally powered.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Wright-Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Disrupts wifi when plugged into macbook pro 2019
customer_reviews.text: I found this hub to be very appealing for the price. I still use it for transfering files and using my printer, but once i plug the thing in, my wifi stops working. I did a little research (I spent hours looking it up) and I've concluded that it's because of the frequencies that usb 3.0 gives off. I wouldn't recommend this product. Spend a couple more dollars and get yourself something much better, or you'll spend even more buying a new product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Francis

customer_reviews.title: compitable, fast and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: My computer just has a bad USP port, then I have only 1 port in my computer. This product is exactly what I want! I totally recommend it. It is small enough to carry with my laptop. Most importantly, it provides a very fast data transportation between portable storage and the computer, as well as my android phone. I also find its compatiability towards different equipments, as it can be recognized instantly when I plug it to my laptop as well as desk computer. My mouse works well on it, and my U-storage, my card-reader, all works well. And it is pretty cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Randall

customer_reviews.title: doesn't seem to power devices consistently
customer_reviews.text: Love the small size of this hub and the fact it's 4 ports instead of 3. The problem is that it can't seem to maintain power for things like bus powered drives, or wireless headsets that my other usb-c hub can, even when they're the only connected device. I'm using this with a 2018 Macbook Pro. This is great if you need to connect a keyboard/mouse or a yubikey or something really low draw, but if it needs regular bus power, consider a different hub. Unfortunately, it's not worth the time to make the trip out to an amazon return location to send this back.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Alienware R5 17 since the machine only has two USB 3.0 ports. This device is great for providing power to the Thermaltake cooler I have, but when I plug any kind of device into it that transfers data I get choppy audio (in the case of my wireless headset) and input lag (in the case of my Roccat mechanical keyboard). I haven't tried anything other than those device in it quite yet, and honestly I probably won't. For the price it works great for providing power and I am okay with that.
customer_reviews.author: Facelessman01

customer_reviews.title: I was struggling with getting 2 usb monitors to work ...
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling with getting 2 usb monitors to work with my laptop simultaneously on windows 10, this was my only solution after trying several adapters, apparently windows 10 only allows multiple usb displays through the USB C connection and this hub. Each external monitor has 2 usb's one for the connection and one for power, i put both in using a 4 ports and now i got 3 screens everywhere i go...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my MacBook Pro which has only one TYPE-C port. Now I could connect all my USB devices without any problems. I plugged it to my MacBook, then connected a usb drive to the dongle. There was not problem for my laptop to recognize the device at all. Then I went on to test file transfers. I transferred a few large files from my usb drive to my laptop. The files were transferred pretty fast. Like other Aukey products I owned, this Aukey4-port USB-C to USB 3.0 is very compact, light weight and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great USB 3.0 Expansion
customer_reviews.text: Awesome USB 3.0 hub! I’ve been using this to connect my VR headset and 3 sensors and its worked awesome! It helps connect all the items in one so i can easily unplug all. They all are recognized by my PC and no complaints! I have had friends recommend this one to me because I need more 3.0 slots and its been great for them for months!
customer_reviews.author: Edmond

customer_reviews.title: It Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I use this at the office. We have an open office plan, so I take my computer and find a different place to work frequently. I need to plug in my headset and keyboard dongle repeatedly, so I just leave them plugged in to this so I can attach all my USB Type A devices and an HDMI monitor all at once to my laptop USB C connection. Saves wear and tear on the USB dongles, and I never break one off in my computer any more. This device looks well made and feels very solid (no "twist") and seems like it will last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Mandel

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use this with a MAC (that is the main reason most people would need). Kept losing connectivity. USB drive would show up, disappear, show up again, disappear. Wasn't able to copy data. Added wireless headset dongle. Couldn't keep connectivity either. Unfortunately had to return.
customer_reviews.author: cseken

customer_reviews.title: Basic hub that works well
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally left my home at hub while traveling with my laptop and a couple USB A accessories. Aukey & Amazon came to the rescue with two day shipping and got me up and running. It's a basic hub but does exactly what it say, converts one USB C port into 4 USB A ports. Works very well, small, and exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: maxmatthews

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for charging
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed something to charge my phone through usb. Using this on my MacBook Pro & charging my phone through the one of the ports isn't providing my phone with enough juice to charge normal. I bought a USBC charger from Walmart & it worked as I wanted. So dont waste your money if you were looking for this to charge your device from a laptop. Just buy a usbc charger. I believe the USB ports worked well for my usb but I mostly wanted this to function well with charging..
customer_reviews.author: Javon

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this after buying a Microsoft Surface because most of my files are on a USB and I couldn’t think of a good way to transfer necessary files or how to clean up what I had on duplicate USB’s. Other than emailing or texting each file. This made file management much simpier.
customer_reviews.author: Alycia S. Ernst-Amador

customer_reviews.title: When it works it is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: When the hub works, everything will work reliably. However, sometimes it takes few plug an unplug for the hub to power on via USB. I have tried with other USB-C hubs I own, and those have no issue. For that reason, I can only give a 3 stars. Updated: 10/07/2019 I am updating my review to 5 stars as they promptly followed up with my issue and offered a refund. It was a pleasant surprise to see there are still companies out there care about customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jie Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Signal loss for Macbook Pro 13
customer_reviews.text: Returned after 3 days, it allowed me to return for some reason. Bought this product a week before for my girlfriend's MacBook. It seems like most wired mouse works fine with it, but all wireless mouse shows a connection problem, which is losing signal about 1 second in every 2 seconds. Then I ordered another one today and try to return this one, and it turns to be not eligible for return. That is weird.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I have a small laptop with few USB ports, so I use this hub for connecting my external hard drive, printer and a few other accessories. It has worked great so far; very consistent connectivity and quick transfer speeds. In the past, when connecting my external HDD through USB hubs, I've tended to have trouble with it disconnecting or not being recognized, but that hasn't happened at all with this hub. It has been exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: BriarRose

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly with thunderbolt on HP laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great hub for my music production on HP laptop. It allows connecting an external sound card , portable music keyboard controller, SD card and another macro controller. Everything is connected with one thunderbolt port on HP laptop and I have experience absolutely no issues with this hub which is super fast in a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Very useful with my new model surface pro which is very limited with the single USB port. This transitions it to a total powerhouse with all the capabilities of a laptop. Got a slot for my USB flash drive, Dongle for my game controller, and for my phone. So small and simple, yet does a big job. Thumbs up from me
customer_reviews.author: SteveTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work on MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can backup my 2017 MacBook Pro to an external harddrive. I needed an adapter because my laltob doesnt have a USB slot. My Macbook didn’t recognize this device nor did it recognize my external hardrive when plugged into this. Actually nothing worked when plugged into this. My external hardrive and my flash drive. I went and bought an Apple adapter and it worked fine. Not sure if it’s because Apple only allows users to use Apple adapters or something. But if you’re trying to get this for your MacBook, dont. Just buy an Apple adapter USB-C to USB. Other than that, this product looks good. It comes with 4 slots. Very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Hina

customer_reviews.title: Great way to add a few extra usb ports.
customer_reviews.text: My PC has one usb C port and juuuuust 1 too few usb A ports. This little guy fixed that handily and helped me consolidate 4 devices to 1 port, freeing up a ton of room for extra peripherals. Easily able to support my streamdeck, wacom tablet, microphone and external HD. Data transfer speed is good, even with every port used.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Unusable and unreliable with keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this hub with a number of peripherals and it has worked fine when I had my Elgato HD60S capture card plugged into it alongside an external HDD. However, trying to use it with my Leopold FC660M keyboard leads to missed or repeating keystrokes all the time and with my Logitech M750 mouse sees dropped clicks and mis-inputs all the time. Extremely disappointed in this but it's hard to tell if it's a power problem, a bandwidth problem, both, or another problem all together. Even when only one of the keyboard or mouse is plugged into the hub it still faces issues.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Good helper
customer_reviews.text: The device works fantastic! I have 2 additional hdmi monitors, a wireless mouse, a USB-c phone charging cable and a flash drive hooked up to it and all work seamlessly. And all I have to see is one cord plugged into my thunderbolt port, everything else is tucked away behind my monitors! Then when I need the laptop to travel I unplug one cord and all the rest remains ready for when I get back to the office!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I plugged in the adapter to my computer I couldn't use the internet. When it is unplugged I can search with no issues but as soon as it is plugged in google searches become unresponsive. My macbooks network showed no additional traffic with the hub plugged in so I don't think it is a virus but something funky is going on. Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Solid USB hub, works great with my laptop and Oculus.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Acer Helios 300 laptop as I needed more USB ports for my Rift and 3 sensors. It worked absolutely flawlessly, plug and play, no drivers required (Win 10) and everything has been working great. Device is small, ports feel solid and there are absolutely no bandwidth issues. I'd absolutely recommend this, no questions.
customer_reviews.author: Griff

customer_reviews.title: Simple Little USB-C Hub
customer_reviews.text: Ever since getting my new MacBook Pro with only thunderbolt/usb-c ports, I’ve been complaining about needing an adapter for everything. This little guy is very light weight, like you can feel it’s only plastic, but it does feel sturdy. If you need usb3 make sure you plug into the right port, as there are two different speeds. It’s labeled on the bottom. My plan is to simply keep this in my backpack for quick thumb drive access or to hook up to an HDMI projector. I expect it to do the job without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona

customer_reviews.title: Interferes with wifi
customer_reviews.text: As a USB adapter, it works fine. No problems at all. BUT it regularly interferes with wifi. It took me several frustrating days of trying to figure out what was wrong with my computer. I needed the adaptor to connect my keyboard and mouse to my Macbook, so if it kills the wifi connection, it's pretty useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: rachaelb949

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Drobo and MacMini
customer_reviews.text: Needed some more old-style USB ports on my Mac mini so I plugged this in. Currently just a USB Drobo attached to the hub but that works fine with somewhat heavy use (photo storage, live video recording, time machine backups).No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Blouch

customer_reviews.title: Causes interference with my wireless mouse when any USB 2 device plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I plugged this into my 2018 Mac Mini, my wireless mouse goes haywire. As soon as I unplug the hub from the USB-C port the mouse goes back to working normally. I've tried plugging in my USB 2.0 devices into all the different ports on the hub, but no change in the interference it causes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_CustomerRV

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. I plugged it into my HP laptop and it worked the first time. Never again. The best I got once was working for two minutes then cutting out. The laptop is less than a year old and the USB ports all work so the problem is with this adapter. The worst part is Amazon wouldn’t let me return it. I had to talk to someone about my problem. She was no help and a waste of time since the equipment was obviously defective. I guess it’s back to buying locally for computer equipment.
customer_reviews.author: MaryLBB

customer_reviews.title: USB-C Hub Makes Work so Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the product. I can multi-task very easily with all the tools I need. Wish I had found this sooner! Charge my phone, hook to a thumb drive, and still be able to add a number other devices. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Olympia Amazon Consumer

customer_reviews.title: External DVD and Mouse work through this device but external ...
customer_reviews.text: External DVD and Mouse work through this device but external USB3 HD isn't getting sufficient power (with no other accessories on the hub). Edit: Changed this review from 3 to 5 stars because AUKEY has amazing customer service. They refunded the item and let me keep it, then replaced it for free with an enhanced model. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Troutman

customer_reviews.title: Could be a defect. Not sure
customer_reviews.text: This hub works with my fans but it doesn't work with my keyboard and mouse. Maybe it's defective. I bought it for the sole purpose of using it for my keyboard and mouse. But it doesn't work. I don't understand why.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: I love the overall look and feel of this product, as the finished metal feels very high quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love the overall look and feel of this product, as the finished metal feels very high quality. However, the most important thing is the functionality, right? I'm glad to say that this thing works just fine. I was able to use this with my Galaxy phone and it was reading the contents of my flash drive just fine. Also, I used it for my switch which was also reading the files from my flash drive perfectly! There isn't too much more to say about this device other than it's a simple USB-C hub that looks nice and works perfectly. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: tiaogua

customer_reviews.title: Also ejecting
customer_reviews.text: Every time I come near this thing it ejects. I've tried different USB-C ports on my Mac mini, but whenever I need to move this hub or plug something into it I get Disk improperly ejected, which means my backup disc and external disc, and every improper ejection may harm my info. Sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Full-speed port,running very fast.
customer_reviews.text: My laptop has only two USB ports, and a USB hub does indeed take advantage of all the port's availability. I have a Microsoft Natural Keyboard, a Logitech Gaming Mouse USB Dog Leg, a display with 2 USB port hubs, and it can still run Western Digital Passport 2 TB drives without any problems. These ports are full-speed ports and do not require additional external power, which is great for travel needs, as some of the devices I've tested can't power all of my accessories without the need for additional power. Fortunately, so far, All of my external hard drives are working without any problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Judson

customer_reviews.title: Nice design poorly implemented
customer_reviews.text: I got this hub so I could use the usb c port on my laptop for my keyboard and mouse. The ports on the hub are bad and will not stay connected to any device I connected to it. My flash drive would randomly disconnect as well as the mouse and keyboard if the hub was shifted slightly. I will be Getting rid of this before my devices are ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Riley

customer_reviews.title: Good speeds
customer_reviews.text: Perfect USB c hub, just what I needed for my small laptop that now comes with only USB c. Not that I'm complaining about the fast speed, but only having 1 Port sucks, so I bought this so I'm compatible with USB a. This one works very well with good speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Caused issues with new MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my new MacBookPro which only has USB-C ports. Unfortunately the cable is not shielded and as soon as I plug it into my MacBook, I loose Wifi. I wish I had known this beforehand. I ended up purchasing an Apple adapter instead and have not had any wifi issues.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: For use in USB-C laptop port
customer_reviews.text: I purchase a new high end gaming laptop, only drawback was the number of USB slots available, but it did also have the new USB-C slot, so I purchased this to have more USB slots available. Works great, no fuss, plug and go. Adds 4 USB 3.0 slots, three on the side and one up front.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Interference from Hub
customer_reviews.text: WiFi immediately cuts out on my 2018 MacBook Air when I plug it in. Confirmed that it was the adapter after trying to duplicate the issue with all my other peripherals. Cannot recommend this for Mac users.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Its good. Maybe not great for Imacs
customer_reviews.text: I like this but Im not really sold on it. I wanted to like it more but it was having issues with my imac 5k. Maybe its meant for mac books? I talked it over ith Aukey and they had (and always have) great customer service. I was refunded and they even shipped me another one to try. Sadly same story. Maybe its firmware? Either way, its a great clean concept that would work better for laptops I believe.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandr Verbetsky

customer_reviews.title: This device causes bad 2.4ghz wifi interference
customer_reviews.text: I liked this for a while until I found out it was the source of my mysterious wifi connection problems on my macbook pro. If you use wifi on 2.4ghz band with this anywhere near your laptop it will make it slow or completely unresponsive. It took me a while to figure this out but after lots of google searching somebody pointed out that if the wire on these devices is not shielded then it will cause interference. I tested this out when I was having wifi problems one time by covering the wire with foil and sure enough it made my wifi connection respond again
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I like this product very much. It's really great!
customer_reviews.text: This USB C hub is high quality and affordable. It's worth my money. It is light in weight small in size and easy to travel. With this hub I can connect my mouse and keyboard to my MacBook Pro without having to buy expensive ones from the apple store. It even supports HDMI which helps me connect my MacBook Pro screen and projector! I wish I could get this earlier. This hub design is cool! I highly recommend it to people who need such a hub and don't want to spend a lot of money. It's really great!
customer_reviews.author: Valmic Seetahal

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This usb-c hub was exactly what I was looking for. It allows me to plug in my keyboard, mouse, portable hard drive, and connect my iPhone. I have not experienced any lag from the keyboard or mouse, the hard drive transfer speed is superb, and my iPhone charges quickly. I have not experienced any heating issues from the hub. It has stayed cool so far. It has only been a week so I will adjust rating if durability becomes an issue. Overall, extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Zigabo

customer_reviews.title: Very much worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and it was exactly what I needed. The ports are quality and are nothing of the cheap china ones that will break, this includes the type-c end. I’m not too sure on the exact downloading speeds but they seem exactly like using a laptop or pc port. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Roshan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Adapter
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase many Aukey products in the past, including a similar USB-C hub. This one works just as good and gives plenty of flexibility for I/O. The build is nothing special, but this is a simple, functional solution to add some USB ports to my desktop through an un-utilized USB-C port on the motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bob JR

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Yes,nice little USB hub unit. The surface material is actually made out of metal instead of some cheap plastic. It’s pretty thin so it won’t take up too much space. A good amount of ports that’s great usage for me when I use it to transport photos over from my SD card. I was lucky enough to score this with a 5% coupon applied, so that was pretty good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Polk

customer_reviews.title: Since I gotten it I have used it twice and boy did it save me a great deal of work
customer_reviews.text: I use this to transfer my documents and photos from my phone to my computer since most of my job requires me to be out 8n the field and became a headache carrying my laptop with me the taking pictures then bluetoothing my photos and note to my email only to upload them from my email to my computer files. Since I gotten it I have used it twice and boy did it save me a great deal of work.
customer_reviews.author: Naja Jackson

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great product
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the product, I used it for a period of time. After connecting to the computer, the communication was stable. So far, no abnormality has been found, and the power supply is powerful. 5V, 4A input, each port can guarantee 900mA current output, charging or driving 4 mobile hard drives at the same time without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Wittmar Oberg

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat for $12 and some change after tax.
customer_reviews.text: I needed more USB ports on my laptop, Lenovo y740 2019 model. 3 is just not enough. This module solves my issue for needed more ports for hot swappable things, I use all 3 of my USB ports built in for mouse, headset, and microphone, but I needed to use the usb c so I could connect my phone, USB flash, and Arduino for when I'm in class coding. The long cable length might be an issue for some people but it was a blessing for me, since the Arduino has a tiny micro B cable, the extra length managed to help me more.
customer_reviews.author: James adkins

customer_reviews.title: Real USB 3.0, Fast Data Transfer, Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, great deal for the money. This is real USB 3.0, very fast data transfer, but make you use the USB 3.0 on port on your device (2.0 USB port would not give you the speed). My devices connected through the hub had no problem being recognized and fast. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ida

customer_reviews.title: Arrived today and immediately did not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought a brand new MacBook Air and this hub to use my external hard drive with my new computer. This hub arrived today. I took it out of the package and plugged it in and it immediately did not work. I tried every USB on it and none of them work. I hope the seller gets in contact with me. I will be looking for a refund ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: zoriy

customer_reviews.title: The connectivity you crave!
customer_reviews.text: Works well! I have a slim PC for work and between telecommuting between the office and my new laptop, this gives me the extra ports I need, or possibly crave for connectivity. Just like electrolytes I crave in the summertime.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my ultrabook to hook up a keyboard, mouse and a webcam. All of the peripherals would disconnect and reconnect constantly because there is not enought power. I ended up buying a powered USB hub for more stable data transfer and more ports. Unfortunately this item is ineligible for returns and I am out 15$ plus tax. The cord is also very short. I recommend buying something else Update: After writing this review aukey messaged me and sent another unit. Much better performance this time. Very happy with their customer service would recommend buying from this brand
customer_reviews.author: Jean-luc

customer_reviews.title: Good for unpowered peripherals
customer_reviews.text: If all you want to connect are thumb drives, SD card readers, maybe a mouse, then this is an excellent hub. If what you're using requires any amount of power (gaming keyboards, flight sticks), then this doesn't supply enough power to run them.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and good quality, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: AUKEY USB C Hub Ultra Slim USB C Adapter with 4 USB 3.0 Ports works great! It’s great for travel and transfer data at a very high speed. It recognizes my devices quickly. Four Type-A USB 3.0 ports and great for charging your smart devices, plugging in a keyboard or wired mouse. Very portable and is backwards compatible with USB 2.0 and 1.1 devices. Overall, a solid USB-C mini-USB port hub, inexpensive and good quality, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rlu

customer_reviews.title: Good for traveling
customer_reviews.text: The quality was really good and I don’t have to worry about it breaking on me. It was lightweight and I can carry it round with my laptop. My laptop originally only has 2 usb spots but now with this I have 4 more. It’s perfect because I need to plug in both my mouse and extra keyboard and I can still plug in a thumb drive.
customer_reviews.author: Yuki

customer_reviews.title: Works with devices that don't require power
customer_reviews.text: Works great with devices that don't need to be powered much - memory sticks, scanners, etc. For things like portable disk drives, you're pretty much limited to one device at a time. In that case, buy a powered hub instead - but that limits the utility, since you have another power supply and cable to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and fast!
customer_reviews.text: This USB hub is very stylish and has tiny size, it is made from aluminium or similar metal. I bought it because the fourth USB port lies on the far side so I can plug big USB device there without interfering with the other 3 ports. After I bought I begin like it more because it looks beautiful with the azure accent color on the USB ports and the green led . It doesn't take any space on my laptop bag because it is very small and thin. It is functional,looks durable and well made!
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Seemed good but stopped working within a week
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for connecting my drum modules to my MacBook Pro, dongle worked good for a few days but stopped working completely within a week, sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: AL Arsenault

customer_reviews.title: Stop working
customer_reviews.text: Very light and small, perfect for frequent travelers. Updates: Stopped working after few days of usage. I am retuning it
customer_reviews.author: BelL Belahouel

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: very useful product, help me out with the short of USB ports on PC. Good quality and worth this price
customer_reviews.author: littlexsx

customer_reviews.title: missing an adapter or a goofy item that cannot be returned
customer_reviews.text: I have a brand new cpu and new power strip with USB ports and this (NOT RETURNABLE) adapter doesn't fit in anything that has power? One end fits into my device and the other end has no cord/adapter? Sent an email so hope they reply
customer_reviews.author: Happy Nana

customer_reviews.title: Broke After a Couple of Months
customer_reviews.text: The hub itself is broken and won't connect any of my devices anymore. It's the hub itself since I tried everything to fix it. My keyboard and mouse will randomly disconnect in the middle of whatever I'm doing and my external hard drive won't even connect, so I can't access anything on it for now. This item was great because it connected many devices to one port and I'm disappointed that it broke so quickly. Would not recommend. UPDATE: Seller contacted me and sent a new one. The new one works perfectly fine. Very satisfied with the customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Tashima

customer_reviews.title: Ultra portable, slightweight, and does all I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an existing larger usb hub, highly recommend this one, no issues connecting multiple devices and getting the needed voltages. great purchase, and an ever better price
customer_reviews.author: Justin A.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!  Compact handy and well made!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to have. It is slim and easy to store, as it takes minimal room. It would be useful to travel with as it has the extra plug ins. And the usb c adapter is made well itself. It is exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Hope❤️

customer_reviews.title: Constantly disconects and reconnects on every computer it is plugged into.
customer_reviews.text: The product does not work properly at all. It constantly disconnects and reconnects and that is even with just one of the USB ports occupied. It doesn't matter what computer it is plugged into, or what USB is plugged into it. You can be attempting to charge your phone, or using it to read a flash drive. It ticks on and off constantly, no matter what Computer you are using or what slot it is plugged into.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Joesephine

customer_reviews.title: Good USB-C to USB-A hub adapter
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for my laptop to get a few extra USB ports. Wish it had a USB port on it as well, but I can live without that. Let's me connect more devices.
customer_reviews.author: ZapixTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This USB C Hub comes with a great quality for a great price. Definitely worth my money. It is light weighted and small size, so it is easy for traveling. With this hub, I can connect my mouse and keyboard with my Macbook pro without having to buy expensive ones from Apple store. I wish I can get this earlier. This hub is a pretty cool design! I would highly recommend this to people who need a hub like this and don't want to spend a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kidalia Romero

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful
customer_reviews.text: This device was not powerful enough to connect my wireless mouse and wireless keyboard dongles to my MBP. Also the USB port holes were very....particular.....you had to be very precise about inserting the dongle into the USB port.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Szweda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Working very well, my mouse, keyboard and headset says plugged into one device, only one thing to unplug from the laptop when I'm ready to go. I might try the HDMI port soon, not not ready to trust that much to one port on the lapyot.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gilles

customer_reviews.title: Feels solid, very small, performed well - initial review.
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday and hooked it up to my laptop -- I am presently using it for a keyboard, mouse, and a usb card reader. It's extremely small and appears to be working great.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Takes daily unplugging and plugging in. No issue. Except for some reason, certain configurations prevent my mouse wireless module from working?
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: works for gaming
customer_reviews.text: i have a gaming laptop that requires alot of usb plug ins(rgb mouse pad wireless mouse fan mouse charger etc) and i dont like them poking out all over my pc so i got this and it works as intended. the only down side is if you disconnect it you have to un plug all the usbs and re plug them back into the hub.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It's really easy to use and easy to carry. I like it too much. I recommend you to buy it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mini wharf. . You can get a port, which is especially important for dual-port MacBooks. It has usb-C partial discharge power supply and high-definition video. I really like it to have a USB-C data port, so it is a great project. It is light, not too big, and has the function of plugging in the charging cable, so that it can be charged all the time when it is connected to my computer. I like it very useful and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Blakney

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Seemingly Durable!
customer_reviews.text: The hub is the perfect size for travel and has more outlets than most of the others I've used. So far, I've experienced no lag which is important because I am using it for my drawing tablet! Overall, the device feels solid and premium despite the lower price. I also like color and design.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, great product
customer_reviews.text: This hub is a lightweight USB-C hub that packs a lot of ports into its tiny puck of a frame and looks good doing it. It's simultaneous port ability really stood out for me and with it being so compact, it made it easy for travel gig work. The transfers are seemless and with the usb c you can't get too much better. I was surprised I got such an improvement from such a simple addition.
customer_reviews.author: alauren

customer_reviews.title: Aukey made good on the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: 5/21/18: Aukey contacted me and requested information regarding the defective part. They then refunded my purchase, sent me a replacement, and also send me another hub! Great customer service! The replacement part is flawless. I will definitely purchase another Aukey product again! This product quick working two days after I started using it. The cable connection into the computer is really flimsy. Very disappointed. I purchased it for my new computer that was later arriving so now I'm out of return period. DO NOT PURCHASE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Francis A.
